page.title: 13Houses in Aston Clinton
page.content: Aston Clinton is a village containing a mixture of old and new houses. The old houses are mainly on the main A.41 road and turnings off into Brook Street and Weston Road. Since 1970 much of the farmland within the village has been used for housing. Aston Clinton is made up of small estates of between 70 and 100 houses mainly built between 1970-1985. These houses are of two or four bedroom properties. Buckland and Drayton Beauchamp are small villages mainly of older houses and farms. Aston Clinton has become a commuter village since it is is situated on the main A.41 and is three miles from Aylesbury and Tring both of which serve London by rail.
